title: Lattice of the Fault
description: The Emberlight Forge-Cloister’s blue forges answer only to purpose, and Brina Coil’s voice cuts through clamor like a bell. She needs Aren to escort a neutral survey to the Obsidian Fault, where trapped stars shimmer in noon-dark and a sealed lattice pulses beneath stone. Seven-Kettle Syndic’s envoy, Thorek Brimvauld, waits with a frown like a chisel. The survey must map the lattice without breaking it, for Temple augurs warn it is a sealed hymn, not an ore vein. And yet Indigosatchel rumors whisper of a private clause, inked in shadow, to pry the lattice open and sell the city’s covenant by the pound.
objectives: Escort Emberlight Artificers and Temple augurs to the Obsidian Fault and keep the party neutral under competing claims.
Negotiate safe passage and observation terms with Thorek Brimvauld representing Seven-Kettle.
Use the prism register and memory pin to map the lattice’s pulse without damaging it.
Expose or document any illegal star-metal clauses in Indigosatchel contracts encountered on-site.

dialogue.speaker: Brina Coil
dialogue.lines: We bind fire to purpose and refuse to make blades that exist only to drink. The city needs bearings and sluices, not a hole torn in a hymn. Walk with us at the Fault and keep tempers from running like molten glass. If we can prove the lattice is a song and not a seam, perhaps even coin-counters will listen.

dialogue.speaker: Thorek Brimvauld
dialogue.lines: Our kettles sing true because we listen to stone, not because we bully it. I don’t trust your Ledgerfolk nor your market queens, but I’ve seen an oath-bound man stand fast in flood. Draw me proof that your city won’t steal star-metal from under our noses while preaching restraint, and I’ll see your forges have salt and iron through winter. The lattice wakes when you lie to it; keep your words square.

dialogue.speaker: Aren Siltwarden
dialogue.lines: I’ve seen enough oaths to know which ones drown you and which ones keep you afloat. We map, we don’t mine. If the lattice is a sealed song, I’ll stand between it and greedy hands until my arms shake. Thorek, Brina—hold me to my word, and I’ll hold the city to yours.

items: Obsidian Bearing Kit (improves mobility on slick stone)
Syndic’s Iron Chit (trade goodwill at Seven-Kettle stalls)
access: Supervised access to the Obsidian Fault observation ledges
